prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The height is approximately twice the width. The length of the shorter side is about half the length of the longer side. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. The euler angles are set to [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees and the translation vector is set to [0.4707, 0.0, 0.309]. Next, create the 2D sketch on the plane defined by the coordinate system. 1. Sketch face 1: 1. Loop 1: 1. Line 1: Start Point at [0.0, 0.0951], End Point at [0.7456, 0.0]. 2. Line 2: Start Point at [0.7456, 0.0], End Point at [0.75, 0.0342]. 3. Line 3: Start Point at [0.75, 0.0342], End Point at [0.0044, 0.1293]. 4. Line 4: Start Point at [0.0044, 0.1293], End Point at [0.0, 0.0951]. This loop consists of 4 line curves. Now, scale the 2D sketch using the given scaling parameter `sketch_scale` with a value of 0.75. Then, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector provided by the coordinate system. Lastly, extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: 1. Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.2624 2. Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 3. Sketch scale: 0.75 The operation for this part is a "NewBodyFeatureOperation". This results in the creation of a new solid body for part 1. The height of part 1 is 0.75 units, the width is approximately 0.75 units, and the length is 0.2624 units. (Note: The length has been rounded to 7 decimal places to match the given JSON data.)</description>
